intro: Cyrtandra paragibbsiae, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically range in color from pink to purple. The plant is evergreen, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in montane rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected under Hawaiian conservation laws.
